body:
Comment 11: 
I rolled back the fix, because it broke execution on Windows.

I don't think we have to make Gosched a no-op, but I also think we can say that it
*might* be a no-op. It's best effort, and the effort doesn't have to be very good.

Another possible fix, if this really matters, is to edit gosched instead of gput. Right
now it says:

	runtime路mcall(schedule);

It could instead say:

	if(g->lockedm) {
		runtime路entersyscall();
		runtime路exitsyscall();
	} else
		runtime路mcall(schedule);
_Status changed to **Accepted**._
